job_history.work_description: Provided advocacy services appropriate to client needs to a caseload of approximately 30 clients, through in person and/or phone contact. Advocacy services included crisis intervention, risk assessment, safety planning, supportive counseling, and assistance in accessing community resources.
Assessed the mental health, physical health and supportive services needs of up to ten children and their families per week by conducting biopsychosocial assessments and other clinical strategies.

Mentored and tutored 7th grade students at Markham Middle School in South Los Angeles. Referred students to Behavior Counselors, Attendance Counselors, and Gang Intervention Program Counselors when appropriate.

Acquired and incorporated input from local community members into research. Conducted, transcribed and coded interviews between parents and children (ages seven to twelve) regarding animal behavior and evolution using both an interactive museum display and children's books.

skills.name: Counseling
skills.explanation: Provided supportive counseling services to clients as a Bilingual Domestic Violence Advocate, and conducted biopsychosocial assessments as an Intern, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Case Management
skills.explanation: Managed a caseload of approximately 30 clients as a Bilingual Domestic Violence Advocate, and assessed the needs of up to ten children and their families per week as an Intern, showing strong proficiency.

skills.name: Mental Health Assessment
skills.explanation: Conducted biopsychosocial assessments as an Intern, indicating a solid working proficiency in mental health assessment.

skills.name: Community Outreach
skills.explanation: Assisted clients in accessing community resources as a Bilingual Domestic Violence Advocate, and acquired input from local community members as a Research Assistant, showing a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Research
skills.explanation: Conducted, transcribed, and coded interviews as a Research Assistant, indicating a solid working proficiency in research.

skills.name: Mentoring
skills.explanation: Mentored and tutored 7th grade students as a Corps Member, City Year, showing some practical experience.

skills.name: Public Health
skills.explanation: Currently pursuing a Master of Public Health degree, indicating some familiarity with the field.

skills.name: Social Work
skills.explanation: Currently pursuing a Master of Social Work degree, indicating some familiarity with the field.
